intro: Microgonium aerugineum, commonly known as the blue-green microgonium, is a rare and delicate aquatic plant found in freshwater environments. It is characterized by its small, rounded leaves that are typically a striking blue-green color, which helps it absorb light efficiently in shallow waters. The plant has a simple, branching structure with no true roots, relying instead on rhizoids for anchorage. Its flowers, when present, are tiny and inconspicuous, often going unnoticed. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a sensitive indicator of water quality and ecological health.
